snippet: The federal Education Department, citing New York’s failure to meet the goals it promised in seeking financial aid, has put the state on a watch list.
abstract: Federal Education Department has put New York State on a watch list because it has not complied with goals it set, like creating a database to track student records across school districts, when applying for financial assistance through Race to the Top program; New York has received $700 million through program, at least half of which was to go directly to school districts.
lead_paragraph: The federal Education Department, citing New York’s failure to meet the goals it promised in seeking financial aid, has put the state on a watch list.

headline.seo: U.S. Faults New York State on Race to the Top Goals
headline.main: U.S. Faults State’s Progress on Race to the Top Goals
headline.print_headline: U.S. Faults State’s Progress In Race to the Top Program
